data.title: WORLD SCREEN
data.text:
Top Stories

Bell Buys Electric Dreams, Krypton, Life Sentence

Bell Media has acquired three new dramas, including the highly anticipated anthology series Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams, at the L.A. Screenings for its Space and Bravo channels.

Top Stories

ITV America Ties Up with Grant Cross & Lost Arts Entertainment

ITV America has signed Grant Cross and his Lost Arts Entertainment to an exclusive production deal.

Top Stories

PactUS & Global Online Video Association to Host Mini-Market

PactUS and the Global Online Video Association (GOVA) are planning to assemble linear TV and digital content buyers for a first-of-its-kind mini-market.

Top Stories

Jay Hunt to Step Down from Channel 4

Jay Hunt will step down from her role as chief creative officer at Channel 4 at the end of September.

Top Stories

Snapchat & BT Sport Sign Landmark Deal for UEFA Champions League

BT Sport has struck up a commercial partnership with Snapchat to deliver exclusive content during the UEFA Champions League final.

Top Stories

Toonz & ReachMe.TV Team for New Channel

India’s Toonz Media Group and U.S.-based ReachMe.TV have rolled out Toonz TV, a new entertainment channel that will reach more than 100 million viewers in the U.S. at launch.

Top Stories

BBC Factual Controller: “No Subject Should Be Taboo”

BBC Factual Controller Alison Kirkham has revealed more than 35 hours of new commissions across history, science, religion, documentaries and factual entertainment.

Top Stories

YouTube Details New “Ad-Friendly” Guidelines

YouTube has revealed new guidelines for content that is eligible for advertising, taking a "tougher stance" on inappropriate videos.

Top Stories

UYoung Licenses Boyster & Helen’s Little School

Superights has licensed Boyster and Helen’s Little School to UYoung Culture & Media Group, which will represent all TV, home entertainment and digital rights for both shows in mainland China.
